title: Classic Square Dancing
description: Swing your partner! How well do you remember the calls, costumes, and culture of square dancing?

questions.question: How many dancers make up a standard square in square dancing?
What is the person who directs the dancers by calling out moves called?
Which square dance call instructs dancers to walk in a circle?
What does the call 'Do-si-do' instruct dancers to do?
options: Walk around each other back to back

questions.question: What type of full skirt, supported by layers of petticoats or crinolines, was traditionally worn by women square dancers?
What call tells couples to walk side by side in a circle around the square, usually with the lady on the right?
What distinctive type of shirt, featuring decorative stitching and snap buttons, was commonly worn by male square dancers?
What call instructs dancers to face their corner and turn them by the left arm?
In what decade did square dancing experience a huge revival and become one of the most popular social activities in America?
What type of venue commonly hosted square dances in small towns across America?
options: Barns, community halls, and school gymnasiums

questions.question: Which folk dance pioneer helped standardize square dance calls and sparked the modern square dance movement?
What equipment did square dance callers use to be heard over the music and dancing?
options: A microphone and PA system with a record player or live band

questions.question: What does 'Grand Right and Left' instruct dancers to do?
options: Weave in and out around the circle, alternating hands with each person
Form two lines facing each other
Take three steps right then three steps left

questions.question: How many U.S. states have designated square dancing as their official state folk dance?
What social custom was an important part of square dance etiquette?
options: Thanking your partner and corner after each tip (dance)
